getNextDate.name: getNextDate
getNextDate.summary: Returns a SQL date for the next event given a frequency and a time to count from (now if 0).

arguments.name: frequency
arguments.description: A string made of 1 letter (i, h, d, w, m, or y) and a number.

arguments.name: from_time
arguments.description: time A SQL formatted date which will be the base of the operation.

doc.description: Returns a SQL date for the next event given a frequency and a time to count from (now if 0).

params.name: $frequency
params.description: A string made of 1 letter (i, h, d, w, m, or y) and a number.

params.name: $from
params.description: time A SQL formatted date which will be the base of the operation.

getNextDate.comments:
/**
   * Returns a SQL date for the next event given a frequency and a time to count from (now if 0).
   *
   * @param  string $frequency A string made of 1 letter (i, h, d, w, m, or y) and a number.
   * @param  int    $from_time A SQL formatted date which will be the base of the operation.
   * @return null|string
   */

getNext.name: getNext
getNext.summary: Returns the whole row for the next CRON to be executed from now if there is any.

doc.description: Returns the whole row for the next CRON to be executed from now if there is any.
